CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and taken into custody on suspicion of membership of an organised criminal gang and involvement in kidnapping on behalf of that organisation . On DATE he was remanded in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant and twentyone other persons on the above - mentioned charges .

CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings against the applicant and the CARDINAL other accused commenced before ORG . CARDINAL hearings were held in total . Throughout the proceedings the applicant ’s lawyer repeatedly requested that the applicant be released during trial , but those requests were dismissed at the end of each hearing by way of an interim decision using an identical expression , namely “ having regard to the nature of the offence with which he is charged and the state of the evidence ” .

CARDINAL . On a number of occasions the applicant ’s lawyer objected to the interim decisions of ORG extending the applicant ’s detention , and in each case the objections were further dismissed by ORG using the aforementioned identical expression .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him , in total , to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and upheld the first - instance court ’s judgment in respect of the applicant ’s membership of an organised criminal gang , but quashed the judgment in respect of the sentence imposed on the applicant for kidnapping .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was referred back to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to release the applicant pending trial . He was accordingly released DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to imprisonment for , in total , DATE , DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . The case is still pending before ORG .
